radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is markedly dilated up to 17 mm in caliber and fluid-filled with calcified appendicoliths noted at its base and tip. There is extensive adjacent inflammatory phlegmonous change involving the cecum and terminal ileum. Numerous enlarged reactive ileocolic lymph nodes are present. The lung bases are clear, and other abdominal organs (liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach) are unremarkable with no fluid collection, abscess, or free intraperitoneal gas. No bowel obstruction is noted.
